text: One of the first games I got for the SNES back in '91 and the music is still some of my all time favorite. Konami knew how to get the most sound out of the old school Nintendo consoles.

text: I loved this music since the day I first heard it. I feel like it's an underrated tune.
author: PRChingon

text: I have yet﻿ to play a Castlevania game, but I do know how great this series is known for its music. I'd probably say that this game has the best soundtrack before Michiru Yamane became the staple composer for the next 14 years until she resigned from Konami in 2008.
author: Eric C.

text: One of the best castlevania games. The Soundtrack is amazing :D.
author: Redfoxe

text: I loved this game :O my favorite stage was the one with dancing couple ghosts. the music fits so well. It maybe this one LOL I don't remember how it sounded only that it was good.
author: Amiiix

text: The soundtrack is one of my favorites ever, thanks to its mix of moody/dissonant music providing an unsettling and cinematic feel. The 3rd stage alone has 3 movements (Caves, Waterfall and Submerged City). Dracula's Theme might be my favorite final boss theme ever (#555): I'm in the hall leading up to him, the torches light up as I walk past them and the music starts playing; you reach his room and the battle starts while the music continues﻿ playing. Very effective, I was terrified as a kid.
author: SupraDarky

text: AVGN made a really great Castlevania retrospective, and his thoughts on this game pretty much mirror mine: this is my perfect Castlevania (it's part 3 of the retrospective on YouTube). This is my #1 go-to game when I feel like playing a platformer for a short period of time, sometimes just to play a quick level. The controls are perfect and the variety in level artistic design provides a constant breath of fresh air.
author: SupraDarky
